title: Add a noticeable "requirements" section for each tutorial

content.raw:
It's very common that someone starts going through a tutorial and only half-way they realize they have the wrong Gazebo / OS / ROS version. Lots of wasted hours and frustration which could be saved with some big obvious warning upfront. 

Right now, each tutorial has a small version box on the top right, which is often missed by users:

![version.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/RMMxjX/images/251298850-version.png)

It would be nice to list things like:

* Min / max Gazebo version. Does the feature require that Gazebo be built from source? Is it available in a [released](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/13893/trouble-with-the-animated-model-actor-tutorial/) version?
* Min / max ROS version 
* Supported OS(s) (for example, [SVG extrusion doesn't work on Mac](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/13760/trouble-importing-svg-from-tutorial/)).
* Compiler requirements (for example, [does it need C++11 support?](http://answers.gazebosim.org/question/13869/ros-enabled-plugin-examples-use-c11/))
* Additional packages needed
* Additional hardware needed

A bonus would be to filter tutorials according to requirements. For example, "I use Gazebo 4 on Mac, show me all the tutorials which I can do".
